meanings.definition: A person who speaks or writes with hostility or bitterness.
meanings.sent1: The inveighers at the meeting criticized everything without offering solutions.
meanings.sent2: The online inveighers flooded the comments section with negative remarks.
meanings.sent3: The inveighers in the play made everyone laugh with their exaggerated complaints.
meanings.sent4: Her words were like arrows, sharp and piercing, as she joined the ranks of the inveighers.
meanings.sent5: The image of the inveighers shouting angrily is etched in my mind.

meanings.definition: To speak or write with hostility or bitterness.
meanings.sent1: She inveighers against the unfair treatment she received at work.
meanings.sent2: He constantly inveighers about the state of politics in the country.
meanings.sent3: The toddler dramatically inveighers when told it was bedtime.
meanings.sent4: His words inveighers like thunder, shaking the very foundation of their friendship.
meanings.sent5: The author's powerful words inveighers against social injustice.
